answers.answer: Well, there are a number causes for pain and cramping. But since you didn't specify an area of your body - abdomen, legs, arms, head, etc - your two best bets are; 1.) Google pain and cramping for ideas; 2) Go see a doctor.By the way, your glucose numbers look good, borderline high yet good.

The pain is in both feet and ankles.  I take five neurontin and a januvia every day because of postprandial high glucose numbers.  I've had peripheral neuropathy and diabetes 2 for about 7 years now.  I see a neurologist, endocrynologist, podiatrist and my primary doctor and so far no real answers.

question: Why is it that even though my latest A1C was 6.0 and my numbers are always around 100, I still get terrible pain and cramping?
title: Blood sugar pain
